column1: Will Amazon.com begin to accept any cryptocurrency for purchases on the US site before 1 October 2022?
column6: ['Business', 'Technology', 'Society']
Crypto has dropped and shows no sign of resurgence... CEO has stated that it isn't likely at a recent expo and i'm not not inclined to believe him a liar
There has been no formal announcement that this will soon be available. Not even 2 days ago during the Amazon Fall Showcase.

I think the reason I’m right is because of how close we are to the end date there has been not much attempt or persuasion into why Amazon should accept cryptocurrency. This would be a big change for the website and I think if it was too happen it would happen and change overtime not in this short notice

Although there are various ways of paying digitally that have been adopted by Amazon, cryptocurrency is a far more drastic change as there are legal and ethical complications involved in setting up a crypto-system for payment. This is let alone the fact that the system for digital financing would have to be altered drastically by then in order to accommodate payment in this manner such as digitalcoins. This doesn't seem feasible with the time left until October 1st.

Currently, Bitcoin is highly volatile and its value is on the decline. However, cryptocurrency has been more accepted worldwide as a form of currency, so Amazon may implement a crypto payment option in the future. There is no evidence to speculate that Amazon will have crypto as a payment option by Oct.

When Amazon began accepting Venmo payments it announced it 90 days in advance. Accepting Venmo is a much less significant shift than accepting crypto so we can expect acceptance to be preceded by an announcement that occurs, at minimum, several months prior to launch. In the absence of any such announcement, debut of crypto on 1 October is unlikely.

Given how little time is left, and the lack of news to suggest this will happen, I do not believe Amazon will accept any cryptocurrency by the 1st. It scares me to put a prediction involving a tech company at 0%, but I just cannot imagine this happening in this time frame.
No. Benefiting from being late to this question, but regulatory mechanics around crypto still creating high friction.
While it is possible eventually, there has been no indication of any change and it is unlikely it will happen with no hints in the next few days.
Nope

I think that Amazon will eventually accept cryptocurrency, however I think it is very unlikely that this major change will be rolled out within the next 4 days. I have conducted preliminary research into the matter, and have found no indicators signaling this large shift.

I think there is little to no chance that Amazon will begin to accept cryptocurrency for any purchases. Cryptocurrency is still a confusing topic too many in the United States including myself. Adding in cryptocurrency would take a while to figure out the logistics and the programming. And I think that Amazon would make a big announcement if they were planning to accept this type of currency. Since there has been no announcement made, I don't think they would start accepting it out of the blue. Maybe in the next year or so that Amazon may start to find a way to integrate cryptocurrency, but in the mean time I think they will stick to current payment options.
Adjusting for time
based on how unstable crypto is i truly doubt amazon will allow any cryptocurrency by October 1
Crypto is a Ponzi scheme, not seen as an actual legitimate form of currency exchange.
they won't

I have left a very small amount of room for the unknown but at this time Amazon is not taking crypto as a payment option and Oct 1 is quickly approaching. Also, Amazon has roundabout ways to purchase items using crypto. People can use Bitpay Card, or other cards they can buy with crypto, to buy things on Amazon therefore people are able to indirectly buy things from this retailer with their cryptocurrency. This also alleviates Amazon from creating a mechanism to accept crypto for purchases.

1% Crypto has seen a fall in the recent months as a whole. About a year ago, crypto was the "next big thing." While it could rebound, I don't see it soon. Also, Amazon's CEO has stated that they will not be accepting cryptocurrency. The reason is probably because of the inherent ups and downs in the market. I don't see them risking purchases on crypto when they can take the world standard currency USD.
Because they still have not as of 21st sep

Amazon declined the claim that it would accept Bitcoin or any form of cryptocurrency by the end of 2021, stating that the company does not plan to accept such forms of payment anytime within the near future. More recently, Amazon CEO Andy Jassy put forth the statement that the statement previously mentioned remains true.

I am giving this a 0% chance because Amazon's CEO came out in April 2022, clearly saying that crypto will not be added as a payment method anytime soon. With this clear message, the chances of crypto being accepted as a payment method on amazon are none. These types of changes take months to develop especially with such a big online shopping industry like amazon. The chances of a potential scam or fraud can become greater if adding crypto as a payment method is achieved too quickly, especially since crypto is still a growing source of currency and many people do not know how crypto works still.

Given remarks from the Amazon CEO in the Spring, Amazon is in no current state to institute the usage of cryptocurrency as a payment method. With this recent statement, nothing to indicate a change in Amazon's thinking, and the decline of cryptocurrency from the public eye, it is highly unlikely that Amazon will make such a move in this timeframe.

As of April 2022, Amazon CEO said they were nowhere close to accepting cryptocurrency as payment. While it is clear Amazon is considering the possibility of accepting cryptocurrency eventually, I do not believe they have the capacity to begin doing this so soon. Additionally, it seems that crypto is declining, which I believe would further prevent Amazon from making this move.
Crypto seems to be declining, and Amazon likely won't make such a large change in such a short timeframe
The fake money tide seems to be ebbing in general; no reason to do this at the moment.
Because the Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said in April 2022 that Amazon will not be adding cryptocurrency as a payment option anytime soon.

The volatility of cryptocurrency has been displayed in the public forum over the last calendar year. It would not make any financial or corporate sense for Amazon to accept crypto as a form of payment after this volatility has been widely discussed in mass media.
Not going to happen.
crypto is very volatile this year and has fallen dramatically.
Crypto is too volatile to be used by Amazon.
1) crypto is very volatile this year

I don’t believe Bezos would be interested in this. If I’m mistaken I believe this would only happen in a time where the market is stable and mature, there are many issues currently which for a successful company like Amazon would limit upside and just create negatives.

It seems more and more people have finally begun to regard fake money less like a substitute for fiat money and more like a flutter in the speculative group with, say, papaya-juice futures. Amazon will have noticed this, and most likely decided not to get caught out by wild and unpredictable fluctuations in a notional medium of exchange. (There is a rumour, though, that they will begin to buy and sell papaya-juice futures. Don't miss out on this one.)

I see this as incredibly unlikely (less than 1%). There has been no indication in the payments space that Amazon is dedicating any resource to this endeavour. Secondly is the market volatility across crypto, meaning Amazon would need to implement an elaborate hedging strategy to ensure it does not lose money on violent swings. Amazons current currency hedging strategy is to not, so I do not believe crypto fits into the business model. Finally, what is the upside of this? Amazon is customer first, so what real value is this driving? I do not see any personally, as I see crypto as more of a speculation investment vehicle at present, rather than something with utility.

a lot of regulatory framework still required. ETH merge likely happening in September, the success (or failure) of which will impact a lot of the crypto moves going forward. With it being so close to that, and regulatory framework still in it's early days, I would say the chances are slim to none that they will accept it before Oct 1st 2022.
Yeah... nope
No change her
Minimal chance. Facebook's coin got killed by regulators as soon as it started, so they won't make their own. And Amazon would only hurt their brand by introducing a non-Amazon-made coin.
"Amazon CEO says not adding cryptocurrency as payment option anytime soon"
https://www.protocol.com/bitcoin-jumps-on-amazon-job
Crypto market is in pieces and extremely volatile. If AMZN did not want Crypto last year they definitely will not want it now.
Maybe

So going a bit through my previous forecasts: How the times changed indeed! The meltdown of Bitcoin basically killed cryptocurrencies as mode for economic activity on a broad scale to a tiny niche of what was in it's best times not more than a small market or probably never left the niche altogether. Nothing else than highly speculative and risky investment.

All things considered, this could be a good time for Amazon to launch it's own digital currency, sort of along the line of buy low sell high, near enough rock bottom and ppl could have a appetite for a name with stability, again will it happen before the above date...
Reaffirming forecast
Could happen, but unlikely while so volatile.
With the recent crash of terra usd and terra Luna this is highly unlikely to happen until some measures ensuring stability of cryptocurrency is in place
Crypto has been deferred to at least 2023
I think with the recent loss of value of some notable cryptocurrencies, the chance has gone from low to zero.
The Amazon payment team is exploring cryptocurrencies as payment.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mKcKCl4rEWA
Looks like they will stick with real money at least for a while.

Crypto is niche and would require Amazon to a lot of human admin without meaningfully expanding the customer base. They would have to put a surcharge on the payments to pay for processing and crypto people wouldn’t like that.
I think the reality of ka ka currency has become a reality, and the piramid is collapsing little by little, until it suddenly crashes.
Crypto volatility + time
The dramatic fall in LUNA, TERRA and USDT stable coins
Let it ride.
I'm feeling less certain than i was a few months ago.

Not in the current crypto-market condition. A binance-sponsored heavyweight coin named Terra (LUNA) lost 98% of market cap in just one week and even the attached stablecoin TerraUSD (UST), which by design is supposed to have a low volatility and to trade at around 1.00, today crashed to 29 cents on the dollar. The coinbase stock lost 83% versus all-time high.
Updating forecast down to 44%. The crypto community seems to becoming less organized and less legitimate (preying on uneducated, desperate people -- a bit like multi-level marketing).

Very few websites accept crypto - with etsy probably being the largest example - so there's no market pressure to do so. However, over 100 million people worldwide have bitcoin wallets so the base is growing. I doubt Amazon will accept any crypto it doesn't set up for itself, or which is backed by a government (cbdc).
It looks very unlikely.https://twitter.com/Reuters/status/1518396875547815936
Feels like something they would have announced at the most recent earnings call as a way to blunt the trauma if it were in the works.
Responding to economic uncertainty and slowing revenue, seems this would be not worth the risk.

I've always been skeptical on this question, so the recent news almost seals it with a 'no' for me (e.g. https://www.ndtv.com/business/cryptocurrency-as-a-payment-option-not-anytime-soon-says-amazons-ceo-2893141 "the e-commerce giant is not close to adding cryptocurrency as a payment option to its retail business"). However there's still more than 5 months on the question and the statement is clearly intended to have limited scope.
It sounds probable. On the other hand I think the influence of banks on Amazon is significant.
Taking the CEO at his word that Amazon is "not close" to dealing in crypto yet.
Considering that it is a tool with an uncertain risk in an almost uncertain environment, it seems to happen in the future. Maybe even with its own cryptocurrency.
unlikely
Wing it
https://thepaypers.com/payments-general/worldpay-to-offer-direct-usdc-settlement--1255600
There is no pressing need. Amazon is not going to lose sales because they don’t accept crypto. I Magnus they will eventually, and it will be in their terms when they are comfortable with it.
its a way to make money
https://thepaypers.com/payments-general/worldpay-to-offer-direct-usdc-settlement--1255600
Continuing to reduce this as time passes
Updating my forecast to reflect an article saying they are developing a blockchain with plans for use of crypto tokens during 2022. Still pretty speculative that it happens within the next 6 months.
https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/currencies/bitcoin-outlook-volatility-confidence-institutional-investors-experts-cryptocurrencies-btc-ether-2022-1
Time decay.
I don't think there's any particular reason for any major retailer to start accepting crypto now vs any point in the last 5 years.
Ongoing volatility makes it unattractive at present.
Amazon will create its own crypto and launch it as a pilot project at some point in May - June 2022.

I think this may happen in the longer term, but not within the time set by this question. The question is specifically about when Amazon will begin to accept any cryptocurrency, not just announce that it will accept, or anything similar. This is quite constraining because Amazon would most likely want to deploy its own cryptocurrency solution, whether that is something that plus into an existing cryptocurrency (e.g. an Ethereum token or similar) or an entirely new cryptocurrency. In both cases, Amazon would have to announce that they are working on this in some way, if only by recruiting people for this project. (This assumes that their internal workforce is not enough to achieve this and that they have not recruited a significant amount of people to work on this without significant rumours spreading.) Then there could be regulatory hurdles to go through, as did Libra/Diem, which would not resolve by the end of September.
Notching down my forecast to reflect the passage of time.
Following crowd.
Cryptos are way too volatile for Amazon to accept in the short term.
Reducing my estimate to reflect less time left on the question.
https://www.investopedia.com/articles/company-insights/090216/when-will-amazon-accept-bitcoin-amzn.asp

No end in sight to resolve bitcoin's volatility issues JPMorgan Estimates Bitcoin’s ‘Fair Value’ at $38,000, 12% Below Current Price https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-02-09/bitcoin-s-volatility-versus-gold-implies-38-000-value-jpmorgan
Recent earnings passed with no implementation, moving probability lower.
https://www.investopedia.com/articles/company-insights/090216/when-will-amazon-accept-bitcoin-amzn.asp
Passage of time.
Crypto currency is far too volatile to be used as a foundation for purchase good and services. This is one thing Amazon would do well NOT to lead on…
Updating for passage of time.

IMHO, cryptocurrencies are the bubble of our time! I understand that some companies (or countries!) operate with cryptocurrencies to differentiate themselves and stand out from the rest. However, Amazon has a strong competitive position and can surely introduce many other innovations, without falling into this puddle. Perhaps this is a very biased and personal view, so I will give a 5%, just in case I am missing the point.
Will Amazon launch its own cryptocurrency before Oct 1? An article from July 2021: https://fortune.com/2021/07/23/amazon-crypto-coin-job-posting-cryptocurrency-blockchain-product-lead-payments/
I do not see its happening. But it may not be 0%.
Minutes after my last prediction, I stumbled on this article https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/16/walmart-is-quietly-preparing-to-enter-the-metaverse.html

When looking at the average consensus, there is no justification for my optimistic prediction, after all - I have no insider information on what is being planned. For the same reason, I can't agree with the overly pessimistic general opinion from the crowd. however, I will keep revisiting this and start decreasing the probability as time goes on. My optimism and the probability I've given is either going to improve my score, or burn it further.

Probability seems very low. Arguments against: The biggest companies that accept crypto are Microsoft, Wikipedia, AT&T and non accept 'any cryptocurrency'. Tesla accepted bitcoin, but retracted support. If more companies retract support it would not be a good sign. European crypto regulation also doesn't look too favorable for crypto. China's ban on crypto also doesn't look good.
Not too sure about this one. 1. Demand from merchants and buyers

Revising my forecast up just a bit, despite the timeframe shrinkage, given that Amazon does have a "crypto team" in place - no doubt they are exploring the issue in theory. I have a weird guess that they'd probably have to have a full plan announced by June for there to be any chance such transactions take place by 01 October.
Stablecoin only seems more likely than broader acceptance but for the big bills Amazon has to pay- those companies want US denominations for payment for construction, electricity, spaceships etc.

I'm still feeling positive about this prediction - it seems like Amazon is working towards a bitcoin solution this year. The challenge to meeting this challenge are: 1. Will it be implemented in the timeline, i.e. October? 2. Will there be US regulatory constraints that stop or constrain sales via crypto?

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2021-07-30/amazon-has-1-55-trillion-reasons-to-start-accepting-crypto https://www.fxempire.com/forecasts/article/amazon-could-be-the-first-among-faamg-to-launch-a-crypto-token-849008

We see quite some pros and cons on amazon adopting the usage of crypto for their purchases. The major constraints we considered are: tight deadline, regulatory issues, volatility of the cryptocurrencies. The pros did not appear as significant e.g. possibility of competitor accepting which may force amazon to adapt and the usage of stablecoins.
Adjust for passage of time, no recent news appears to increase the likelihood.
If they can find an adequate hedge against bitcoin fluctuations I think they will do this. I am not sure such hedges exist yet.
Almost certainly not.
I do not believe Amazon wants any regulatory complications from accepting crypto.
https://www.fxempire.com/forecasts/article/amazon-could-be-the-first-among-faamg-to-launch-a-crypto-token-849008

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2021-07-30/amazon-has-1-55-trillion-reasons-to-start-accepting-crypto Part of me wants to believe this to be true, but the other part thinks about the money tied up in BITCOIN. If AMAZON accepted digital currencies, would people trade goods for it? I think yes, if only to prove their point. The true question is whether or not AMAZON could make money from it, I say yes. They will experiment with movie rentals and digital products first. then goods.
I think the chance is extremely small because Bitcoin is so volatile. But I'm moving my forecast up to 10% in trying to prevent Brier score destruction by surprises.

Amazon has a history of disruption and pushing into areas before competitors as well as entering into new markets and disrupting existing ways of doing business. Examples include their own Holiday/Sales day (Prime Day), 2 day shipping and now next day and same day, entrance into the logistics market, and more. I'm not aware of large scale adoption of Amazon competitors into cryptocurrency. This would provide Amazon space to be early to market and push in a direction of their own choosing.

No particular update. I don't know how to update on the fact that Bitpay can be used to buy things off Amazon right now (https://bitpay.com/blog/use-bitcoin-on-amazon-other-crypto-to-buy-whatever-you-want/). I'm also a bit spooked by the Paypal<>Amazon partnership. Venmo, which is owned by Paypal, allows users to buy crypto (but not to transact with it)

Dropping forecast based on extreme volatility of cryptocurrency use from Amazon any time soon. Believe they will rely on third party applications enabling $$$/Crypto exchange to produce a transaction.
Growing surge in crypto activity and Amazon is hiring crypto/block chain engineers with an assumed intent to identify mechanisms to accept crypto currency.

Very unlikely. Cryptocurrency is too volatile (and, in the end, worthless) for Amazon to accept. Guys like Elon Musk can make noise about it, but the market to actually spend cryptocurrency on goods and services will remain niche for a long time, at least until there's a mature market and regulation, which won't happen soon enough to meet this timeline.

I think if Bitcoin acceptance was rolling out anytime soon, Amazon wouldn't have ceased Visa card acceptance in the UK. https://www.theverge.com/2021/11/17/22786966/amazon-visa-credit-card-ban-alternatives-fees

A number of countries are joining the bandwagon of banning crypto currencies. https://www.msn.com/en-in/news/world/bitcoin-ban-full-list-of-countries-that-have-banned-cryptocurrencies/ar-AAR40Oq?ocid=uxbndlbing
Passage of time.

Given the volatility and lack of regulation on crypto payments it seems unlikely Amazon will accept crypto payments that don't solve for both of these key hurdles. A stablecoin or govt. back coin fits the bill, but given what I can uncover on these so far it feels highly unlikely that any of these coins will be available in the US market on such a scale that Amazon would accept them in 2022 (can't see Amazon supporting eYuan any time soon :P). More likely is that Amazon create their own currency - again, this seems unlikely to be a live currency and in wide enough circulation in the next 11 months to be accepted on payments (instead being used as an investment or exchange mechanism).

I agree with @Silly_Sausage and @zak that accepting cryptocurrency for payments is unlikely because it would introduce a big regulatory headache and giant volatility in the worth of payments. My son is also of the opinion that they would have very little to gain by accepting cryptocurrency because of its volatility, as well, and thinks that it wouldn't be worth the risk for them. I agree. I mean, why would you take payment in a form that could lose >40% of its value over the next 3 weeks, as it did just this past May? One could say, well, amazon would just have to hold cryptocurrency and have blind faith that it will always rise in value, but currency investing is not amazon's core business. What's my actual opinion? <1% chance. What's the chance that I'm wrong? Much greater. So I'll go with 5% for now.
Yes.It's a trend around the world.More companies wii accept crypto currency in the future.It will be a big market because it's safe and convenience.
Only tighter regulations would stop Bezos from doing so.

My guess is that Amazon.com will accept BTC at some point but will try it out in another country before the US to test it out. Maybe in a country that has a lower rate of access to traditional banking accounts. Not sure yet if this timeline will work for the US without any new information out yet.
If this is going to work it would have to be in house and before June 2022
Very little incentive for amazon to do so, and a potential headache on regulatory front.

There are so many people who would be forced into taking huge risks (volatility) regarding payments for services by Amazon accepting cryptos. They have been focused on getting tax collection straightened out to prove they are an honest broker, accepting crypto goes agains that at the current time.

1) Updating for the passage of time. 2) "Tim Cook has invested personally in BitCoin, but Apple has no plans to do so." NYT Headline 3) "Apple has no immediate plans to accept Bitcoin as a means of payment." https://news.google.com/articles/CAIiEGTtElGl-UYz-al1HS4AzxwqFwgEKg8IACoHCAowjuuKAzCWrzww9oAY?hl=en-US&gl=US&ceid=US%3Aen
Continued exploration of other organizations accepting cryptocurrencies (Twitter).

First: cryptos are inherently unstable. Amazon doesn't want to get stuck with a currency they cannot exchange. There is an exploit with an unstable currency, where you specifically buy with it when its value is highest. Amazon operates on relatively small margins, and wouldn't want to do something they can easily lose large sums of money with. Thus, Amazon will not accept cryptos before they stabilize, which will not happen until they have concrete buying power.
Opening bid: I'm going to bet that Amazon will accept crypto tender on checkout by 1 October 22. Why would they not?
BTC does not make sense for Amazon-purchases, acceptance of non-CDBC stablecoins will be delayed as Bezos is still trying to gain favor for Blue Origin.

The pathway I was thinking of was for Stripe or some other payment processor to make this more mainstream. But thinking about this more, I think it's fairly unlikely that Amazon would accept an external payment method (I think it doesn't accept paypal?), and I think it's fairly unlikely that they will roll their own, or that the mainstream American cards will.
Amazon are forward thinking
@cafebedouin
A little bump on the back of interest shown from AWS (1).

Crypto in long-term is socio-economically bad, since the gov cannot easily redistribute money, or print money for emergency uses in disasters and wars. Although its alternative fiat USD is also not very good due to inflation, but countries can function with inflation as long as it is contained. Countries function less well if the gov cannot redistribute money. Still, Amazon may accept it somewhat in small scale just to be remain popular.

I give it about a 1 in 4 chance that Amazon accepts cryptocurrency in the next year. My first inclination was that it likely will do so in the coming months given the statements about hiring a cryptocurrency expert. The contradictory story about Amazon not looking at adding cryptocurrency as a method of payment is from a "a single, unnamed 'insider.'" Not a very reliable story. So, it appears Amazon is probably laying the ground work to accept cryptocurrency payments, but appears to not be rushing to failure. The recent launch of the U.S. bitcoin futures exchange is encouraging for the "future" of bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies. (https://www.msn.com/en-us/money/markets/what-the-first-bitcoin-futures-exchange-traded-fund-means-for-the-cryptocurrency-industry/ar-AAPTA1P?ocid=BingNewsSearch) However, my forecast is a 1 in 4 chance given that the U.S. congress is looking at passing a "Cryptocurrency Act by the end of 2022," meaning Amazon and other corporations may limit risk by waiting until after legislation is passed establishing a better legal/policy framework for cryptocurrencies in the United States. (source: https://www.paymentscardsandmobile.com/cryptocurrency-acceptance-digital-currencies-hit-the-mainstream/#:~:text=As%20is%20widely%20known%2C%20PayPal%20and%20Square%20have,have%20also%20recently%20confirmed%20they%20will%20accept%20crypto)

Bloomberg listing 1.55 trillion reasons for Amazon implementing crypto in operations. But I believe the tax and accounting headaches still are too big for crypto to be widely used for payments. Will there be any change to US rules and regulations in the coming year that will make less of an headache to use crypto?
i really continue to have no idea about this one.

With research, Laplace's law, defering to the crowd, I come at a 25%. But when I ask my intuition, I just think it's much lower. I'm not going to go to 5%, but I trust my gut feeling enough to go from 25% to 15%

I can see how a large company with huge cash flow could make tons of profit just on bitcoin price fluctuations. So Amazon could get into the game, then even if its algorithms are off a ' bit' it's just a marketing expense.

A new partnership between Bitpay and Verifone could allow you to soon buy pizza with cryptocurrency - Business Insider https://www.businessinsider.com/bitpay-verifone-buy-pizza-taco-bell-with-cryptocurrency-2021-9 Tue, 28 Sep 2021 07:00:00 GMT ef198a677711f0483d8d7af78e7c376c
Amazon will not want to be left behind in the race to adopt, and as other companies move to adopt (e.g. recent announcement from Visa), this increases the chance they will move too.

No one has addressed the potential Tax issues Amazon could face and how this would align with its business model - though lessened if they accept stable coins, but then how does Amazon trust the stable coin provider if they want to convert it into fiat? How would consumers feel about every transaction being subject to capital gains instead of just using fiat? Amazon are already the world's leading commerce company, why would they need to go against the regulatory grain and accept digital currencies when they've attained their world leading position accepting fiat? What exactly is Amazon going to gain from reaching out to the very limited number of people who hold crypto compared to their global consumer base? What is it about crypto that Amazon would gain from adopting it? Even credit card fees are a drop in the ocean compared to the amount of revenue it earns. What is the cost-benefit ratio to Amazon for adopting crypto? Amazon has a large government customer base, particularly with AWS, so would it benefit Amazon to nark off Capitol Hill?

Factors inhibiting defi and crypto acceptance including inefficiencies are being addressed in 2021. Some regulatory concerns will settle opening a path for stability. Finally, media attention raising public awareness of the existing state of cryptocommerce will solidify confidence and propel many more institutional acceptance of the digital currency.

As crypto transaction continue to be off the books, the traditional banking routes are blocked to holders. PayPal has been working diligently to normalize transaction routes to facilitate mainstream use. Many e-commerce participants support this normalization, while government regulators struggle with clear ownership and safeguards to prevent money laundering. This paradigm reminds me of legalizing marijuana, where banks were unable to process funds from the sales. We see the start of that issue being resolved within the normal banking structure. I believe that resolution will motivate the big tech companies to bring forward their crypto models in 2022. As for Amazon beginning to accept crypto in the US, I think they will formulate a banking process to challenge PayPal’s process that will sit outside our current understanding of banking. To make the transactions live in time for the winter holiday shopping would be optimal.

Multiple conflicting reports to date. USA commerce reported Amazon would follow in Tesla’s announcement of crypto currency use. Additional reports of using their own ‘token’ capability. Follow-on reporting highlights customer service/browser experience and not currency. Recent job searches highlighted higher level leadership opportunities for Digitial currency or blockchain leaders.

It appears they will accept bitcoin by the end of the year. Rumint also suggests that they are working on their own crypto currency which is part of a larger strategy to gain dominance. With newegg, paypal, and others already accepting this should spur amazon to do the same.
h/t @cafebedouin

Cardano and Amazon Partnership? Charles Hoskinson Can't Confirm It - Coinspeaker https://www.coinspeaker.com/cardano-amazon-hoskinson-cant-confirm/ Thu, 23 Sep 2021 13:36:32 GMT 1d6b222cd663f65cb2fd8238f0a7bc4f

So I was reading the expIanation to this question a bit more carefully than I've done previously. I think what is going on at Amazon, they are actually preparing to accept cryptocurrencies. to be more precisely they are going for stablecoins and with that I would asume also includes central bank issued cryptocurrencies. Amazon is just waiting for some kind of regulation of crypto implemented and/or central banks are issueing crypto versions of national currencies is implemented and while waiting they are setting up all the necessary soft- and hardware to be ready as soon its legally safe to make comercial transactions and trade in cryptocurrencies. Furthermore I was recently reading "How Innovation Works" by Matthew Ridley. The Author also describes, how Jeff Bezos has set up a working culture and also a failure culture to encourage his employees to suggest and persue even seeminly crazy ideas to get the few ones which will eventually succeed and bring money in. Although Jeff Bezos is not anymore in charge at Amazon and I expect the culture there is going to be more settled in future as is goes so often when a company is established enough but for the moment, working on crypto and blockchain technology doesn't seem too far fetched. I think Amazon is be quite ready to lounge crypto payments and is just waiting for legislation to catch up. That is the reason why I'm giving such a low percentage.

Amazon is in the process of hiring a blockchain expert and indicated it is interested in accepting cryptocurrency in the future. Amazon may also be developing its own cryptocurrency. In addition, Whole Foods (owned by Amazon) already accepts cryptocurrencies. Key concerns are price fluctuations and coin manipulation.
@Greyowlsova 's probably right, and I should moderate a bit.

As a leading online purchase platform, Amazon has been developing at a rather fast pace. An interesting article that is influencing my forecast states that "The blockchain descriptor page for Amazon shows that AWS currently supports "25 percent of all Ethereum workloads in the world." Ethereum is the second-largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization directly behind Bitcoin. But Ethereum is more than digital money." Source: https://www.inc.com/tor-constantino/why-amazon-will-likely-make-a-massive-move-into-crypto.html
Amazon has a history of disrupting the e-commerce industry over years and it successfully built trust and reputation worldwide with excellent services.
Timeline is short, but wall-mart and AWS are hiring for developers and leads.

Amazon wants to project that it protects costumers and vendors, so that reduces the likelihood they will accept it. Collecting and distributing taxes will be problematic although that's much more applicable to their third party vendors than them. Additionally the volatility in value is an interesting case. They may accept the currency then lose value before they mail out the item. However, the volume of transactions at different times would negate that risk and likely give them the advantage as value raises and lowers (even on an hourly basis).

So I was going a bit through the previous forecasts and I don't think it's likely of Amazon going to accept cryptos any time soon. For that they are at the moment way to volatile and furthermore too unregulated. Cryptocurrencies seem to me (at the moment) more like a means of speculation than a viable method of purchasing and selling everyday goods and services. But the bigger objection against introducing cryptocurrencies as payment method anytime soon is actually it's unregulated nature for the moment. The legislative process of working out a regulatory framework and probably some court rulings how regulation is to be interpreted and applied will take some time. Until that cryptocurrencies are basically Wild West. Furthermore there is talk among politicians, bureaucrats and the public of harsher big tech regulation, so in a climate like that doesn't seem like a good idea to engage in something, which might be targeted with something like the kind of Operation Choke Point. About the hiring of crypto and blockchain developers, I think this is (for the moment) more to explore opportuneties for the future and to have the specialists right at hand when crypto becomes the real deal, but it doesn't seem to me, that crypto payment is on verge of introduction at major player like Amazon within the next twelfe months. I would actually say that Amazon is not really right company to look at when it comes to observe the development of crypto payments for the mass market, I think companies like Visa or Mastercard are much better suited to watch this development. But this is just a thought which occured to while writing this here, but still might be a valuable input for somebody else here.

Amazon is likely to want to be able to accept cryptocurrency as a form of payment before October 2022. Tesla did succeed in (temporarily) accepting cryptocurrency payments, which demonstrates that it is possible for a business to do so. Facebook, however, faced a lot of pressure upon announcing Libra in 2019 and has essentially backed down against it. This involved Facebook creating and controlling (with others) their own cryptocurrency, which is a level above simply accepting cryptocurrency payments. However, the reason for this was to control the currency itself and be able to rely on a stable cryptocurrency that Facebook could actually trust to be stable (unlike e.g., Tether). If Amazon only wishes to accept cryptocurrency payments, in any form of cryptocurrency, then they could do so before October 2022. However, if they wish to have more control over the cryptocurrency that they accept (like Facebook did) then this may not happen until after 2022.

It seems quite likely that Amazon is hiring and is interested in exploring accepting payments. This hinges on time to market and given that this only requires the acceptance of any cryptocurrency (including an Amazon token) for some subset of their products.
